labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: NewFeature
labels.description: Something to build that is a new item.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Issue reported by:** @joekaufmanexpensify **Slack conversation:** [#migrate](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C07NMDKEFMH/p1769715923958039) ## Action Performed: 1. Create an expense report on a workspace that allows editing report title. 2. Open the report. 3. Tap More. ## Expected Result: You should see a `Title` button in `More`. Tapping it should open the existing page to edit report title. It'd only appear when the report title is editable. ## Actual Result: This isn't possible. You have to open the `Details` page from `More` or by tapping the report header. We've received feedback from customers that this is challenging to find. ## Screenshots/Videos [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

## Action Performed:

1. Navigate to Reports → Reports
2. Open any report that contains multiple expenses
3. Click to open any individual expense
4. Attempt to scroll down in the Right-Hand Panel (RHP)

## Expected Result:
The RHP should be scrollable, allowing users to view all expense details.
## Actual Result:
Scrolling does not work in the RHP for certain expenses.
Some expense details are inaccessible.
## Workaround:
Unknown

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** **Reproducible in staging?:** Needs Reproduction (Reproduction blocked , Requires Expensify card transactions) **Reproducible in production?:** Needs Reproduction **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): #Expensify Bugs ## Action Performed: 1. Log in as a user with reviewer or approver permissions 2. Open an expense report submitted by another user (original cardholder) 3. Locate an expense on the report (e.g., an Expensify Card transaction) 4. While reviewing the report, select “New” to create a new report for the expense 5. Observe the newly created report and where the expense is moved ## Expected Result: The new report should be created under the original submitter/cardholder’s account, with the expense remaining on that user’s report. ## Actual Result: The new report is created under the reviewer’s account, and the expense is moved there. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: [$250] Reorder bottom navigation tabs: Swap Inbox and Reports positions

labels.name: Reviewing
labels.description: Has a PR in review

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Weekly
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: NewFeature
labels.description: Something to build that is a new item.

body:
## Overview Update the bottom navigation tab order to place Inbox before Reports. ## Current Tab Order 1. Home 2. Reports 3. Inbox 4. Workspaces 5. Settings ## Proposed Tab Order 1. Home 2. Inbox 3. Reports 4. Workspaces 5. Settings ## Implementation Details The tab order is defined in [`src/components/Navigation/NavigationTabBar/index.tsx`](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/main/src/components/Navigation/NavigationTabBar/index.tsx). Changes are needed in two places: 1. **Wide layout** (desktop/tablet): Lines 288-394 - swap the order of the Reports and Inbox `PressableWithFeedback` components 2. **Narrow layout** (mobile): Lines 463-559 - swap the order of the Reports and Inbox `PressableWithFeedback` components ## Acceptance Criteria - [ ] Inbox tab appears as the second tab (after Home) - [ ] Reports tab appears as the third tab (after Inbox) - [ ] Tab functionality remains unchanged - [ ] All platforms (iOS, Android, Web) display the correct order - [ ] Existing tests pass with updated expectations

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.3.11-17 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/80915 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** sdoijsnodijsonjdsoi@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration **Device used:** Mac 26.1 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to Account > Expense rules. 3. Click New rule. 4. Create a rule where when Apple is the merchant, update merchant to Expense. 5. Click Save rule. 6. Go to workspace chat. 7. Create a manual expense with Apple as merchant. 8. Open the expense. ## Expected Result: In Step 4, when creating expense rule, specific merchant name such as Expense or (none) should be forbidden. ## Actual Result: In Step 4, when creating expense rule, specific merchant name such as Expense or (none) is allowed. In Step 8, when expense rule is applied, Merchant field turns empty because of the specific merchant name (Expense or (none)). ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d00f5b40-618b-4fed-a3df-0cf0e1d3986b [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

___

**Version Number:** 9.3.11-17
**Reproducible in staging?:** Yes
**Reproducible in production?:** Yes
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/80734

**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Bug source:** Pull Request QA execution
**Device used:** Web (Mac/Chrome)
**App Component:** Workspace Settings

## Action Performed:
1. Open https://staging.new.expensify.com/
2. Navigate to Troubleshoot page
3. Enable "Simulate failing network requests"
4. Clear onyx data
5. Navigate to Workspaces tab
6. Create a workspace
7. Navigate to Company Cards

## Expected Result:
The new error UI should be shown

## Actual Result:
The standard landing page is shown instead of the error page.

## Workaround:
Unknown

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.3.11-17 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** N/A - new feature, doesn't exist in prod **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/80648 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** Expensifail account **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration **Device used:** Android 13 / Xiaomi Poco F5, iOS 15.8.3 / iPhone 7 Plus **App Component:** User Settings ## Action Performed: 1. Log into NewDot using Expensifail account 2. Go to Wallet > Import transactions 3. Provide a card name and tap Next button 4. Choose this transactions file: fake_transactions-2026-01-16 10_56_55.629.csv (attached) 5. Tap the Import button > Got it 6. Tap the recently added card ## Expected Result: The card display name should appear immediately when opened for the first time after import ## Actual Result: The card display name does not appear when opened for the first time after import Note: - The card display name will appear after going to another section, then back to open the card in Wallet ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ae0138ee-cb1a-476d-a31b-e749386833cb [Bug7062594_1769839861190!fake_transactions-2026-01-16.10_56_55.629.csv](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/24982060/Bug7062594_1769839861190.fake_transactions-2026-01-16.10_56_55.629.csv) [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
